comment.narrative: National RoadMap for Ukrainian market transition over to EE lighting has been accepted by the Government

National Roadmap for EE lighting market transformation was created and endorsed by public representatives at International conference Development Of EnergyEfficient Lighting Market In Ukraine Current status and prospects
Draft law providing for the phaseout of incandescent bulbs has been duly prepared Draft law and technical regulation for disposal of CFLs have been developed
New sanitary and hygienic health and safety requirements covering LED have been duly prepared
A Study of legal relations covering consumer protection to ensure the quality of electricity supplied was conducted The Project has engaged two experts to support the implementation of the RoadMap for energy inefficient bulbs phaseout from the Ukrainian market

description.narrative: Improved QualityAssurance Quality Control systems for imported and produced lighting products in Ukraine
A new municipal system for CFL collection recycling andor disposal has been launched

comment.narrative: Current unavailability of adequate and orderly operating system
Locally adapted sustainable system developed based on the international best practice

The traditional conference on the strategy of disposal of mercury containing light sources in Ukraine was held in October 2014 There was more than 200 participants The main objective of the conference was to conduct public and professional hearings on new legislation on waste handling In particular the TMEL Project presented the developed strategy technical regulation and law on utilization of household CFLs that were endorsed in resolution of the Conference
The pilot project for disposal of CFLs was completed and results thereof have been applied to develop the CFL disposal system used in several nationwide supermarket chains The Project targeted 7 cities throughout Ukraine and was focused on exchange of used CFLs for the discount to buy a new one During one month approximately 44 000 of CFLs were disposed by mobile disposal factory Also the dedicated materials covering disposal of CFLs have been developed and disseminated among the retail store networks

Largescale Assessment of quality of office light sources has been commenced in March 2015 Results are expected by September 2015 The summarized results of all abovementioned assessments will be presented at the conference on 2224 October 2015

title.narrative: Smart Practices for Oversight on Administrative Services

description.narrative: The Project “Smart Practices for Oversight by Non-State Actors on Administrative Service Provision” aims to improve the delivery of administrative services by local authorities through better public monitoring and creation of effective feedback loop.
The Reference Centre on public monitoring of the administrative service provision is established and functioning.
independent political entity
Other General Services - support to civil society
Documents and reports prepared

comment.narrative: Despite slow progress in introducing mechanisms of oversight by non-state actors on the administrative service provision, there is a number of smart practices of the service delivery improvement due to effective public monitoring and feedback loop with the municipal authorities. Still, lack of necessary skills and limited exposure to the existing best practices present a serious obstacle for the widespread establishment of effective mechanism of public monitoring

description.narrative: The knowledge and expertise of the Reference Center “Self-Help” is transferred to other CSOs
independent political entity
Other General Services - support to civil society
Number of cities where the delivery of administrative services improved

comment.narrative: Despite the increasing number of the civil society organizations in Ukraine, CSOs are on their way to establish themselves as an exponent of the citizens’ voice; moreover, only 10% of them are active and only about 6% of the population engages in civil society organizations. Consequently, the index of citizens’ trust towards CSOs is extremely low (2.6 out of 5). Therefore, the capacity of the CSOs is yet to be built to involve citizens in local advocacy, coordination and information dissemination; raise public awareness and participation in the monitoring of the administrative service provision; and to develop closer cooperation with local governments.

description.narrative: Integrating Rio Convention Provisions (Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD), Convention to Combat Desertification and Drought (CCD), and Framework Convention on Climate Change (FCCC)) into Ukraine's National Policy Framework
Ukraine's implementation of the three Rio Conventions on a strengthened policy and institutionally sustainable development baseline is catalyzed.
capital of a political entity

1. Percentage of respondents who agree that environmental degradation is one of key global issues for future generations. 2. Percentage of respondents who know that greenhouse gas emissions are a key reason of climate change. 3. Percentage of respondents who know that human activities are key reasons of biodiversity loss. 4. Percentage of respondents who know that human activities can lead to land degradation. 5. Percentage of respondents who admit that their own actions can contribute to preservation of the environment. 6. The extent to which Draft Sustainable Development Strategy and Action Plan are ready for Parliamentary consideration for adoption (Scale 0-3, 1 – Draft Sustainable Strategy and Action Plan are produced, 2 – the draft Sustainable Development Strategy and Action Plan are publicly discussed and rated as high quality, 3 – the Draft and Action Plan are submitted for consideration to the Cabinet of Ministers in Parliament). 7. Progress made towards integration of Sustainable Development Strategy Roadmap into national policies (Scale 0-3, 1 – the draft of Roadmap is produced, 2 – the draft Roadmap is publicly discussed and rated as high quality, 3 – the Roadmap is submitted for consideration to the Cabinet of Ministers in Parliament). 8. Progress made towards integration of environmental priorities into national policies: (Scale 0-3, 1 - SWOT and Gap analysis of Ukraine's policy framework and institutional implementation of Rio Conventions completed and presented to line ministries, 2 - a draft of Sustainable Development Strategy is produced, peer reviewed and rated as high quality, 3 - A Concept note on the draft SDS is ready and submitted for consideration by Cabinet of Ministers and Parliament)

A To integrate principles and obligations of the three Rio Conventions into Ukraines national policy framework B To strengthen key institutional and individual capacities to implement policies plans and programmes that deliver global environmental benefits

Rio Convention obligations are an integral part of the Sustainable Development Strategy
SDS Roadmap is an overarching plan of action for the environmental and sectoral action plans
The Government of Ukraine and a wide range of stakeholders systematically review natural resource and environmental policies in a holistic manner in line with Rio Conventions requirements
Recommended reforms and restructuring per the SDS are presented for parliamentary consideration

comment.narrative:
There is no overarching policy that links the Rio Conventions win the framework of national sustainable development
Requirements of the Rio Conventions are not effectively integrated into sectoral legislation
There is little interministerial coordination on the implementation of natural resource and environmental policies
Policy interventions often result in overlap duplication of effort and weak implementation
There is limited stakeholder involvement in the consultative process that informs policymaking

A draft Sustainable Development Strategy has been approved by the Cabinet of Ministers and ready for Parliamentary consideration for adoption
A draft SDS Roadmap has been approved by the Cabinet of Ministers
There is a minimum of 20 increase in the understanding of the Rio Convention mainstreaming among government staff
There is a minimum of 15 increase in the appreciation of the Rio Conventions among the general public
There is a minimum of 25 increase in the acceptance by government representatives and other stakeholder representatives of the legitimacy of the SDS and its accompanying Roadmap

Almost all national stakeholders target ministries in particular demonstrate political will to review the current policies and align them with the Sustainable Development concept international obligations This is especially topical for Ukraine now in the view of the countrys commitment to approximate its legislative and normative frameworks to the EU requirements
Nongovernmental partners stay actively involved in the project and stand ready to support further activities specifically on the way to develop the Sustainable Development Strategy SDS based on evidences and best practices from the neighboring European countries
The project is actively promoting knowledge and handson examples of implementation of the Rio Conventions among the key stakeholders

description.narrative: Environmental Impact Assessment in Ukraine – Preparatory support to the launch of the National Registry
The IRRF is UNDP’s results framework to monitor and report on its achievements against the Strategic Plan 2014-2017. UNDP publishes country level IRRF results that UNDP’s projects contributed to
number of new full-time equivalent jobs created for women 15+ years old
number of new full-time equivalent jobs created for men 15+ years old
total number of new full-time equivalent jobs created
number of additional females benefitting from UNDP's livelihoods interventions
number of additional males benefitting from UNDP's livelihoods interventions
number of additional people benefitting from UNDP's livelihoods interventions
The ultimate objective is development of a functioning Unified National Environmental Impact Assessment Registry (EIA Registry) and provide technical assistance to the first entries.
capital of a political entity
policy, planning and administration

1. Extent, to which the Unified National Environmental Impact Assessment Registry is functional [Scale 0-3, 1 – demo version is developed and tested, 2 – full version is developed 3 – full version is fully rolled out and accepted by the Ministry of Ecology] 2. Maximum number of user accounts in the Registry 3. Results of the independent expert’s assessment of the Registry’s Complex System of Information Protection 4. Number of government officials who built capacities to use the Registry 5. Extent to which the Communication plan is developed and implemented 6. Number of cases that went through the screening 7. Report with lessons learn and recommendations for the further support of the EIA system in Ukraine
